SEARCH
Package it.polimi.is23am10.client.userinterface.guifactory

Class GuiFactory

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.is23am10.client.userinterface.guifactory.GuiFactory
public final class GuiFactory extends Object
GUI scene factory. Creates various GUI scenes for the application. Each scene is created as a static method in this class. The class also contains helper methods for creating GUI components.

The class uses JavaFX for UI rendering.

The factory methods return JavaFX Scene objects that can be used to set the application's stage. The stages are stored in a static map for easy access.

This class is not meant to be instantiated. All methods and members are static.

Example usage: ``` Scene splashScreenScene = GuiFactory.getSplashScreenScene(); GuiFactory.stages.put(GuiFactory.SCENE.SPLASH_SCREEN, splashScreenScene); primaryStage.setScene(splashScreenScene); primaryStage.show(); ```

Note: This is a simplified example and assumes the necessary JavaFX setup has been done.

    • executeOnJavaFX

      public static void executeOnJavaFX(Runnable r)
      Executes a callback inside of JavaFX thread. Mandatory for any scene-change related task.
      Parameters:
      r - The callback to be executed.

    • getSplashScreenScene

      public static javafx.scene.Scene getSplashScreenScene()
      Creates the splash screen scene. The splash screen scene consists of a stack pane with a background and an input name widget. The background image is retrieved from the SplashScreenFactory class. The input name widget contains a label, a text field, and a confirm button. The confirm button triggers the CallBack.confirmNameCallBack.
      Returns:
      The created splash screen scene.

    • getEnterGameSelectionScene

      public static javafx.scene.Scene getEnterGameSelectionScene()
      Creates the enter game selection scene. The enter game selection scene consists of a stack pane with a background and a selection widget. The background image is retrieved from the EnterGameSelectionScreenFactory class. The selection widget contains a label and two buttons (create new game and join game).
      Returns:
      The created enter game selection scene.

    • getCreateNewGameSelectionScene

      public static javafx.scene.Scene getCreateNewGameSelectionScene()
      Creates and returns a new JavaFX Scene for the create new game selection screen.
      Returns:
      The JavaFX Scene for the create new game selection screen.
